files.patch: @@ -119,2 +119,2 @@ - * Double#equals equals} uses representation - * equivalence, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, + * Double#equals equals} uses {@linkplain ##repEquivalence representation + * equivalence}, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, @@ -594,0 +594,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToDecimalCharacter + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -674,0 +678,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -900,0 +909,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -1090,0 +1103,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1103,0 +1117,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1115,0 +1130,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1127,0 +1143,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1144,0 +1161,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1153,0 +1171,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1213,3 +1232,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for details of - * floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1392,3 +1410,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1408,0 +1426,1 @@ + @Override

@@ -310,0 +310,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToDecimalCharacter + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -390,0 +394,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -527,0 +536,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -732,0 +745,1 @@ + @Override @@ -745,0 +759,1 @@ + @Override @@ -757,0 +772,1 @@ + @Override @@ -769,0 +785,1 @@ + @Override @@ -778,0 +795,1 @@ + @Override @@ -795,0 +813,1 @@ + @Override @@ -842,3 +861,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for - * details of floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1095,1 +1113,1 @@ - * The binary16 format is discussed in + * The {@linkplain ##binary16Format binary16 format} is discussed in @@ -1211,3 +1229,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1228,0 +1246,1 @@ + @Override
